messages.subject: Samurai Archives Bookstore
messages.msgSnippet: Just wanted to bring attention to the bookstore for anyone who hasn t visited it yet, or for people who haven t visited it in a while.  With well over 100
messages.messageBody:
Just wanted to bring attention to the bookstore for anyone who hasn't
visited it yet, or for people who haven't visited it in a while. With
well over 100 books on Japan and Japanese history, it should be able
to handle all of your Japanese history and jidaigeki needs. It's
powered by Amazon.com, and for every book sold, a small percentage
from amazon.com goes towards the website.

http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20

Here are the sections:

Sengoku and Kamakura:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=1

Bakumatsu and Meiji:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=3

Ancient Japan:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=2

Edo Period:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=4

Samurai Fiction (Historical Fiction)
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=5

Samurai Cinema (DVDs and books on Japanese film)
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=6

Modern Japanese Fiction (within the last 30 years or so, mostly current)
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=7

Modern Japanese non-fiction (Nonfiction on post-WWII Japan)
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=8

Japanese Politics and Business:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=9

Also, Samurai Archives forum member Les Paterson has recently
published a book on Oda Nobunaga and the battle of Okehazama that I'm
sure members here would be interested in:
http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20/detail/0979039746

Thanks, and enjoy the selection!

messages.subject: Samurai Archives Bookstore
messages.msgSnippet: I have opened the Samurai Archives Japanese history bookstore for business: http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20 The store is organized by historical period.
messages.messageBody:
I have opened the Samurai Archives Japanese history bookstore for
business:

http://astore.amazon.com/samurai-20

The store is organized by historical period. I'm still in the process
of adding books, however most of the popular and best books are
already there. I'll be adding a fiction and DVD section later on.
Every sale goes towards the cost of the domain name and server for
Samurai-archives.com so your patronage is appreciated!

Thanks.
